intro: Triumfetta longicuspis, commonly known as the long-fruited triumfetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale pink or white. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Triumfetta longicuspis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
